availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Newspaper and printing office in Frankfort, Kentucky. Founded by James R. Adams and Edgar W. Robinson in 1840. Published and edited by William Tanner in 1841. Published and edited by William Tanner and Theodore O'Hara from 1843 to 1850. Published and edited by S. McChesney and W. W. Stapp from 1850 to 1852. Published and edited by Samuel I. M. Major, Jr., and aligned with the Democratic party from 1852.

ab.bibl:
Carl E. Kramer and William B. Scott, Jr., Capital on the Kentucky (Frankfort, KY: Historic Frankfort, Inc., 1986), 143, 208.
Willard Rouse Jillson, The Newspapers and Periodicals of Frankfort, Kentucky 1795-1945 (Frankfort, KY: Kentucky State Historical Society, 1945), 16.
